page.title: 09THE PILGRIM FATHERS MEMORIAL
page.content:
The PILGRIM FATHERS MEMORIAL
In the eastern section of the area along the bank of the River Witham there is a memorial to the original pilgrim fathers who vainly attempted to leave Boston for religious freedom in Holland. In 1607 a group of puritans from the north of the county near Gainsborough led by William Brewster William Bradford and John Robinson walked all the way to Boston to escape religious persecution .They had arranged with the captain of a ship to take them from Boston to the netherlands where they would be free to worship as they wished.They had arranged to board the ship south of Boston so as to be safe from the authorities.
